critique: This document is an executive order related to the COVID-19 pandemic. It focuses on expanding domestic production of strategic resources and strengthening supply chains. It delegates authority to the Chief Executive Officer of the United States International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) to make loans and take actions to support the domestic industrial base. The order is temporary, expiring after two years or upon termination of certain provisions of the CARES Act. It does not directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It could be seen as interventionist in the economy, but only in the context of a national emergency. It does delegate power to the executive branch, but it is temporary and subject to existing laws and appropriations.
